text.p: Worldwide Leisure Corp said Monday it will acquire American Western Cos, a company that provides "wellness" health insurance benefits for non-traditional medical treatment programs.

"Additional acquisitions and ventures will be in the area of wellness marketing, wellness publishing, wellness facilities and wellness destination resorts," Worldwide Leisure chief executive George Pappas said in a news release, adding that, "central to our plan is an exclusive Wellness Credit Card presently in final development."
Pappas also revealed that Worldwide is negotiating a contract with Odyssey Cablevision and a joint venture with Doubleday Direct, a subsidiary of Bertelsman AG of Germany.
"Worldwide's Wellness programs and products will find a welcome market in our audience," Odyssey chief executive Garry Hill said.
With Doubleday, Worldwide Leisure will be creating a six million member Wellness Book Club, Pappas said.
Worldwide shares were unchanged at one Monday.
